thread.title: Road rage incident results in gun arrests - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Road rage incident results in gun arrests - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Road rage incident results in gun arrests - Massachusetts news
text:
State Police arrested two men on gun charges after a caller said the pair had threatened him during a road rage incident on Wednesday afternoon.
Police received a call from a motorist driving southbound on Route 95 who said a man in a Volkswagen had pointed a gun at him, according to a department statement.
Related Link Get todayâ€™s headlines right in your inbox Trooper Michael Tryon was able to track down the vehicle and pull over the driver and his passenger in Mansfield police said.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Police identified the driver as Yomar Romero and his passenger as Justin Smith. A loaded .32 caliber Colt handgun was found in the car with a box of 28 rounds of ammunition and a Halloween mask, according to police.
Both men were arrested and will be arraigned Thursday morning. Romero, 21, of Pawtucket, Rhode Island, was charged with possession of a firearm and ammunition without an FID card, carrying a firearm without a license, and default warrant. Smith, 20, of Providence, Rhode Island, is facing charges of carrying a firearm without a license, assault with a dangerous weapon, and possession of ammunition without an FID card.
